components.description: A person checking passports at an international border.
components.title: Passport Control

description: A person checking passports at an international border.
title: Passport Control

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Transport And Map Symbols -> Signage and other symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A person checking passports at an international border. Passport Control was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0  http://emojipedia.org/passport-control/
emoji_net_data.name: passport control

bn:00091483v: Maintain the security of by carrying out a patrol

bn:00085404v: Exercise authoritative control or power over
To have or exercise supreme power, control or authority over, especially military; to have under direction or control.
To exercise influence over, to suggest or dictate the behavior of.

bn:00060925n: A document issued by a country to a citizen allowing that person to travel abroad and re-enter the home country
Any document that allows entry or passage.
A gouvernment issued proof of identity, with which one is allowed to cross a nation's borders.
A passport is a travel document, usually issued by the government of a nation, that certifies the identity and nationality of its holder for the purpose of international travel.

bn:00022026n: A police force is a constituted body of persons empowered by the state to enforce the law, protect property, and limit civil disorder.
A civil force granted the legal authority to enforce the law and maintain public order.
Constabulary may have several definitions: A civil, non-paramilitary force consisting of police officers called constables.
Branch of the government which is charged with the preservation of public order, the promotion of public health and safety, and the prevention, detection, and punishment of crimes.
The force of policemen and officers
Constituted body of persons empowered by the state to enforce the law
An organisation that enforces the law.
With `old bill' as a slang term in the UK

bn:00053450n: A perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent (as a visible clue that something has happened)
A perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent, as a visible clue that something has happened.

bn:00058698n: A member of a police force
A member of a police force, especially one who is male.
An officer of a law enforcement agency.
A police officer is a warranted employee of a police force.
A police officer, especially a junior one who does patrol instead of detection or supervising other policemen.
A police officer or prison guard.
Warranted employee of a police force
An officer in a law enforcement agency.

bn:00016256n: A female letter carrier, a woman who delivers mail.
A man who delivers the mail
Someone (implied male) who delivers the post (mail) to, and/or collects the post from, residential or commercial addresses, or from public mailboxes.
An employee of the post office who delivers mail (post) to, and collects it from, a residence or business, or from public mailboxes.
Someone (implied male) who delivers mail to, and/or collects mail from, residential or commercial addresses, or from public mailboxes

A mail carrier, mailman, postal carrier, postman, postwoman, postman/postwoman, letter carrier or postie is an employee of the post office or postal service, who delivers mail and parcel post to residences and businesses.
Employee of the post office or postal service, who delivers mail to residences and businesses
